text: The Mysterious Writing on the Wall

Belshazzar the king made a great festival for \add a\add* thousand \add of\add* his lords,\f + \fr 5:1 \ft Or “nobles” \f* and ⸤in the presence of⸥\f + \fr 5:1 \ft Literally “to over against” \f* the thousand \add lords\add* he was drinking wine.\f + \fr 5:1 \ft Or “the wine” \f*

⸤When he tasted the wine⸥,\f + \fr 5:2 \ft Literally “At the taste of the wine” \f* Belshazzar commanded \add that they\add* bring \add the\add* vessels of gold and silver that Nebuchadnezzar his ⸤predecessor⸥\f + \fr 5:2 \ft Literally “father” \f* had taken from the temple that \add was\add* in Jerusalem, so that the king and his lords,\f + \fr 5:2 \ft Or “nobles” \f* his wives and his concubines may drink from them.

Then they brought in the vessels of gold that they took from the temple, the house of God that \add was\add* in Jerusalem, and the king and his lords,\f + \fr 5:3 \ft Or “nobles” \f* his wives and his concubines drank from them.

They drank the wine and praised the gods of gold and silver, bronze, iron, wood and stone.\f + \fr 5:4 \ft All these metals have the definite article that does not have to be translated into English to retain the meaning \f*

⸤Immediately⸥\f + \fr 5:5 \ft Literally “In its the hour” \f* ⸤human fingers⸥\f + \fr 5:5 \ft Literally “fingers of \fq the \ft hand of a man” \f* appeared and they wrote ⸤opposite⸥\f + \fr 5:5 \ft Literally “to over against” \f* the lampstand on the plaster of the wall of the palace of the king, and the king was watching\f + \fr 5:5 \ft Or “gazing at” \f* the palm of the hand that was writing.

Then his face changed and his thoughts terrified him, and ⸤his hip joints gave way⸥\f + \fr 5:6 \ft Literally “the limbs of his hip became loose” \f* and ⸤his knees knocked together⸥.\f + \fr 5:6 \ft Literally “his knees this to this they knocked together” \f*

The king cried ⸤aloud⸥\f + \fr 5:7 \ft Literally “with strength” \f* to bring \add in\add* the conjurers,\f + \fr 5:7 \ft Or “enchanters” \f* the ⸤astrologers⸥\f + \fr 5:7 \ft Literally “Chaldeans” \f* and the diviners; the king ⸤spoke⸥\f + \fr 5:7 \ft Literally “answered” \f* and said to \add the\add* wise men of Babylon, “Any man that can read this writing and can tell me its explanation will be clothed \add in\add* purple and \add will have\add* \add a\add* necklace of gold \add hung\add* around his neck and he will rule \add as\add* third \add in authority\add* in the kingdom.”
Then all the wise men of the king came in, but they were not able to read the writing or to make known its explanation.\f + \fr 5:8 \ft Aramaic “the explanation/ interpretation” \f*

Then the king, Belshazzar, became greatly terrified, and ⸤his facial features⸥\f + \fr 5:9 \ft Literally “shining of his face” \f* changed upon him, and his lords\f + \fr 5:9 \ft Or “nobles” \f* were perplexed.

Because of the words of the king and his lords,\f + \fr 5:10 \ft Or “nobles” \f* the queen came into ⸤the banqueting hall⸥\f + \fr 5:10 \ft Literally “the house of the drinking” \f* and the queen ⸤spoke up⸥\f + \fr 5:10 \ft Literally “answered” \f* and said, “O king, live ⸤forever⸥,\f + \fr 5:10 \ft Literally “to eternity” \f* and let not your thoughts terrify you and \add do\add* not let your facial expressions ⸤grow pale⸥.\f + \fr 5:10 \ft Literally “change” \f*

There is a man in your kingdom ⸤who has the spirit of the holy gods in him⸥.\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Literally “who \fq the \ft spirit of holy gods \fq is \ft in him” \f* And in the days of your ⸤predecessor⸥,\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Literally “father” \f* enlightenment and insight and wisdom like the wisdom of the gods was found in him; and, O king, Nebuchadnezzar your ⸤predecessor⸥\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Literally “father” \f* appointed him \add as\add* chief of the magicians,\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Or “soothsayer-priests” \f* the conjurers,\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Or “enchanters” \f* the ⸤astrologers⸥,\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Literally “Chaldeans” \f* \add and\add* the diviners. Your ⸤predecessor⸥\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Literally “father” \f* the king \add did this\add*

⸤because⸥\f + \fr 5:12 \ft Literally “all of because that” \f* \add there\add* was found in him \add an\add* excellent spirit and understanding and insight \add for\add* interpreting dreams and explaining riddles and solving riddles; \add that is\add*, in Daniel ⸤whom the king named⸥\f + \fr 5:12 \ft Literally “whom the king gave his name” \f* Belteshazzar. Now, let Daniel be called and he will tell the explanation.”\f + \fr 5:12 \ft Or “interpretation” \f*
Daniel Deciphers and Interprets the Writing

Then Daniel was brought in before the king, \add and\add* the king ⸤spoke⸥\f + \fr 5:13 \ft Literally “answered” \f* and said to Daniel, “You \add are\add* Daniel ⸤who are one of the exiles⸥\f + \fr 5:13 \ft Literally “who from sons of the exile” \f* of Judah\f + \fr 5:13 \ft Aramaic “Jehud” \f* whom my ⸤predecessor⸥,\f + \fr 5:13 \ft Literally “father” \f* the king, brought from Judah.\f + \fr 5:13 \ft Aramaic “Jehud” \f*
And I have heard that a spirit of the gods \add is\add* in you and enlightenment and insight and excellent wisdom was found in you.

And now the wise men \add and\add* the conjurers\f + \fr 5:15 \ft Or “enchanters” \f* were brought in before me \add so\add* that they could read this writing \add in order to\add* make its explanation\f + \fr 5:15 \ft Or “interpretation” \f* known to me, but they were not able to disclose the explanation\f + \fr 5:15 \ft Or “interpretation” \f* of the matter.

But I have heard concerning you that you are able ⸤to produce interpretations⸥\f + \fr 5:16 \ft Literally “to interpret interpretations” \f* and to solve riddles; now if you are able to read the writing and to make known its explanation\f + \fr 5:16 \ft Or “interpretation” \f* to me, you will be clothed \add in\add* purple and \add a\add* necklace of gold \add will be placed\add* around your neck and you will rule \add as\add* third \add in command\add* in the kingdom.”

Then Daniel answered and said before the king, “Let your gifts be for yourself or your rewards give to another; nevertheless, I will read the writing to the king and I will make known to him the explanation.\f + \fr 5:17 \ft Or “interpretation” \f*

⸤O king⸥,\f + \fr 5:18 \ft Literally “You, O king” \f* the Most High God gave the kingdom and the greatness and the glory and the majesty to Nebuchadnezzar your ⸤predecessor⸥.\f + \fr 5:18 \ft Literally “father” \f*

And because of the greatness that he gave to him, all the peoples, the nations and languages trembled and feared before him; whomever he wanted he killed, and whomever he wanted he let live, and whomever he wanted he honored, and whomever he wanted he humbled.

But ⸤when⸥\f + \fr 5:20 \ft Literally “as that” \f* his heart became arrogant and his spirit became hard \add so as\add* to act proudly, he was deposed from the throne of his kingdom and the\f + \fr 5:20 \ft Or “his” \f* glory ⸤was taken away from him⸥.\f + \fr 5:20 \ft Literally “they took away” \f*

And he was driven away ⸤from human society⸥\f + \fr 5:21 \ft Literally “from the sons of the humankind” \f* and his mind was made like the animals\f + \fr 5:21 \ft Aramaic “with the animals” \f* and his dwelling \add was\add* with the wild asses; \add and\add* ⸤he was given⸥\f + \fr 5:21 \ft Literally “they gave him” \f* grass like oxen to eat, and with\f + \fr 5:21 \ft Aramaic “from” \f* the dew of heaven his body was bathed, until he acknowledged that the Most High God \add is\add* sovereign over the kingdom of humankind, and ⸤whoever⸥\f + \fr 5:21 \ft Literally “to from that” \f* he wants he sets over it.
“But you his ⸤successor⸥,\f + \fr 5:22 \ft Literally “son” \f* Belshazzar, have not humbled your heart ⸤even though⸥\f + \fr 5:22 \ft Literally “all of because that” \f* you knew all this.

And \add now\add* you have exalted yourself against the Lord of heaven, and the vessels of his temple you have brought in before you, and you and your lords,\f + \fr 5:23 \ft Or “nobles” \f* your wives and your concubines, have been drinking wine from\f + \fr 5:23 \ft Aramaic “with” \f* them, and you have praised the gods of silver, gold, bronze, iron, wood, and stone\f + \fr 5:23 \ft All the materials in this list have the definite article that does not have to be translated into English \f* that \add do\add* not see and \add do\add* not hear and \add do\add* not know, but the God ⸤who holds your life in his hand⸥\f + \fr 5:23 \ft Literally “who your breath \fq is \ft in his hand” \f* and all of your ways ⸤come from him⸥,\f + \fr 5:23 \ft Literally “\fq belong \ft to him” \f* you have not honored.
So then the palm of the hand was sent out from his presence and this writing was inscribed.
“Now this was the writing that was inscribed: ‘Mene, Mene, Tekel and Parsin.’
“This \add is\add* the explanation of the matter:\f + \fr 5:26 \ft Or “word, message” \f* ‘Mene’—God has numbered your kingdom and brought an end \add to\add* it.
“ ‘Tekel’—you have been weighed on scales and you have been found wanting.\f + \fr 5:27 \ft Or “deficient” \f*
“ ‘Peres’—your kingdom has been divided and given to \add the\add* Medes and Persians.’ ”

Then Belshazzar commanded, and they clothed Daniel \add with\add* purple and \add placed\add* a necklace of gold around his neck, and they made a proclamation concerning him that he would be \add the\add* third ruler \add in authority\add* in the kingdom.
⸤That same night⸥\f + \fr 5:30 \ft Literally “In it, in the night” \f* Belshazzar, the Chaldean king, was killed.

\f + \fr 5:31 \ft \xt Daniel 5:31–6:28 \ft in the English Bible is 6:1–29 in the Hebrew Bible \f* And Darius the Mede received the kingdom ⸤when he was about sixty-two years old⸥.\f + \fr 5:31 \ft Literally “when a son of sixty and two years” \f*
